intro: Agrimonia godetiana, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Agrimonia godetiana is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
